citeinfo.origin: Stream and Lake Protection Section, Colorado Water Conservation Board
citeinfo.title: ISFTermini

descript.abstract: ISFTermini is a feature class composed of x/y coordinates depicting the upper terminus (UT) and lower terminus (LT) of stream reaches where the Stream and Lake Protection Section of the Colorado Water Conservation Board (CWCB) has appropriated an instream flow water right through July 2007. The Termini have been snapped and referenced to high resolution NHD streams.
descript.purpose: The purpose of ISFTermini is to provide a spatial representation of the upper and lower termini of stream reaches where the Stream and Lake Protection Section of the Colorado Water Conservation Board (CWCB) has appropriated an instream flow water right through April 2008.
descript.supplinf:
ISFTermini points correlate to the beginning and ending x/y coordinates of the Streams_NHD feature data set. Since each stream reach in Streams_NHD has an upper and a lower termini point, there should always be twice as many termini points in the ISFTermini feature class as in the Streams_NHDshapefile.
Stream reaches and termini points have been tied to the 1:24k USGS National Hydrography Dataset (NHD). Because of this, termini points may not share the exact lat/long information with the corresponding Water Court decrees. However, they will be accurate to the landmark locations; ie. headwaters of Stream X or confluence of Stream Y and Stream Z. Please refer to the Water Court decrees for official location information.

theme.themekt: REQUIRED: Reference to a formally registered thesaurus or a similar authoritative source of theme keywords.

idinfo.useconst:
The CWCB's GIS Layers are in the public domain and the recipient may not assert any proprietary rights thereto nor represent it to anyone as other than a Colorado State Government-produced product. These GIS Layers are provided "as-is" without express or implied warranty of any kind, including, but not limited to, the implied warranties of merchantability and fitness for a particular purpose. The user assumes all responsibility for the accuracy and suitability of use of the GIS Layers. In no event will the Colorado Department of Natural Resources or the Colorado Water Conservation Board be held liable for any damages, including lost profits, lost savings, or other incidental or consequential damages arising from the use of or the inability to use the GIS layers.
In some instances, the CWCB staff has noted discrepancies between the decreed legal descriptions of its instream flow water rights and natural lake level filings (i.e., incorrect legal descriptions of upper termini, lower termini, or lake level locations and/or incorrect stream reach lengths). In such instances, the GIS layer represents the CWCB staff's best effort to interpret and represent the true intent of the CWCB at the time it made its appropriation on such streams or lakes.
The CWCB staff intends to update its GIS layers annually to reflect any new appropriations that are made by the CWCB each year and to correct any errors in prior versions of the GIS Layers that might be brought to the staff's attention. Please feel free to notify the CWCB of any apparent errors in the GIS Layer so that the staff can research the apparent error and corrected them if necessary.
idinfo.datacred: Data Set was created by the Stream and Lake Protection Section of the Colorado Water Conservation Board with preliminary assistance from the Bureau of Reclamation.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 3; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.3500

horizpa.horizpar: The termini have been snapped and referenced to the high resolution NHD database. The horizontal accuracy is the same as reported in the NHD database

procstep.procdesc: ISFTermini2005 were updated with new appropriations in 2006 using the ISFAnalyst procedure and tools.

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Calculated field converting "Longitude" field from decimal degrees to degrees, minutes, and seconds.
The NHD ReachCode the termini is referenced to
Categorical variable used to identify whether the ISF Termini point represents the Upper (UT) or Lower (LT) terminus of an ISF water right.
Calculated field using NAD83 Zone 13 projection.
Calculated field using NAD83 Zone 13 projection.
Calculated field using GCS North American 1983 projection.
Calculated field using GCS North American 1983 projection.
The measure of the NHD reach that the termini is referenced to. The measure uniquely locates the point on the reach as a percent of the length
Calculated field converting "Latitude" field from decimal degrees to degrees, minutes, and seconds.
Comment about the termini. The comment pertains to the location of the point or how it was edited to obtain the current location.
Name of the stream the termini is referenced to.

cntorgp.cntorg: REQUIRED: The organization responsible for the metadata information.

cntaddr.state: REQUIRED: The state or province of the address.
cntaddr.postal: REQUIRED: The ZIP or other postal code of the address.

cntinfo.cntvoice: REQUIRED: The telephone number by which individuals can speak to the organization or individual.
